Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the class that has the basic features of all game objects. It is the super class of all other game objects. It is used to render, update, identify collisions and forms the basis of all game objects properties.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    SHUBHAM THAKRAL, TANMAY BANSAL
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Sprite(int[] screenCoordinates)
      In the constructor, we initialize both positions and velocities to zero.

      This method forces the given sprite s correctly so that if it is intersecting on left side, then it is left forced and if it is intersecting on right side, then it is right forced.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(int[] screenCoordinates)
        In the constructor, we initialize both positions and velocities to zero.
        Parameters:
        screenCoordinates - is an array of upper and lower bounds of the screen in XY plane. It is taken so that objects can know the boundaries of screen.

    • Method Detail

      • setImage

        public void setImage(javafx.scene.image.Image i)
        This method is used to set the image of the Sprite object. This method also initializes the width and height of image.
        Parameters:
        i - is the Image object that is the sprite's image to be set.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.lang.String filename)
        This method takes the file path of image as an argument, makes an image of it, stores the path in imagePath and the calls the setImage(Image) method to set the image.
        Parameters:
        filename - is the name of image path

      • setImage

        public void setImage()
        This method synchronizes the image with with the imagePath. This is generally used after deserializing.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double x,
                        double y)
        This sets the position of sprite to x and y
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate of position
        y - is the y coordinate of position

        public void setVelocity(double x,

        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate of velocity
        y - is the y coordinate of velocity

      • addVelocity

        public void addVelocity(double x,
                        double y)
        This adds the velocity x and y to current velocities respectively.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x coordinate of velocity
        y - is the y coordinate of velocity

      • update

        public abstract void update(double time)
        This is an abstract method that updates the position of the sprite according to its speed in the given time. It is made abstract as each sub class will implement its own way of updation.
        Parameters:
        time - is duration for which we want to update

      • render

        public void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        This is the method used to render the image of sprite on canvas.
        Parameters:
        gc - is the GraphicContext of Canvas where we draw the image

      • getBoundary

        public javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getBoundary()
        This is the method that returns the boundary of the sprite. This can be used to detect collisions.
        Returns:
        Rectangle2D object which represents the boundary of image.

      • getLeftBoundary

        public javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getLeftBoundary()
        This method returns the left boundary of the sprite. This can be used to detect left collisions.
        Returns:
        Rectangle2D object which represents the left boundary of image.

      • getRightBoundary

        public javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getRightBoundary()

        Returns:
        Rectangle2D object which represents the right boundary of image.

      • getBottomBoundary

        public javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getBottomBoundary()
        This method returns the bottom boundary of the sprite. This can be used to detect collisions at bottom.
        Returns:
        Rectangle2D object which represents the bottom boundary of image.

      • getTopBoundary

        public javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getTopBoundary()
        This method returns the top boundary of the sprite. This can be used to detect collision as top.
        Returns:
        Rectangle2D object which represents the top boundary of image.

      • getTopHalfBoundary

        public javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getTopHalfBoundary()
        This method returns the boundary of the top half of sprite. This can be used to detect collision with a margin of half body.
        Returns:
        Rectangle2D object which represents the top half boundary of image.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(Sprite s)
        This method checks whether this sprite intersects with another sprite s. To check this, it used the function intersects of Rectangle2D class and calls it on s , passing it's own boundary as an argument.
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite with which collision needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sprites intersects, else returns false

      • leftIntersects

        public boolean leftIntersects(Sprite s)
        This method checks whether this sprite's left boundary intersects with another sprite s. To check this, it used the function intersects of Rectangle2D class and calls it on s , passing it's own left boundary as an argument.
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite with which collision needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sprite intersects with left boundary of this sprite , else returns false

      • rightIntersects

        public boolean rightIntersects(Sprite s)
        This method checks whether this sprite's right boundary intersects with another sprite s. To check this, it used the function intersects of Rectangle2D class and calls it on s , passing it's own right boundary as an argument.
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite with which collision needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sprite intersects with right boundary of this sprite , else returns false

      • bottomIntersects

        public boolean bottomIntersects(Sprite s)
        This method checks whether this sprite's bottom boundary intersects with another sprite s. To check this, it used the function intersects of Rectangle2D class and calls it on s , passing it's own bottom boundary as an argument.
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite with which collision needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sprite intersects with bottom boundary of this sprite , else returns false

      • outOfFrame

        public boolean outOfFrame()
        This method checks whether the sprite has gone out of frame of screen by using screen coordinates.
        Returns:
        true if it is out of frame, else false

        The toString implementation of Sprite class which prints it's position and velocity

      • forceSpriteOnBottom

        public void forceSpriteOnBottom(Sprite s)
        This method forces the given sprite s on the bottom of this sprite.
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite which needs to be forced bottom

      • forceSpriteCorrectly

        public void forceSpriteCorrectly(Sprite s)
        This method forces the given sprite s correctly so that if it is intersecting on left side, then it is left forced and if it is intersecting on right side, then it is right forced. This is used so that the two sprites don't overlap on each other on collision.
        Parameters:
        s - is the sprite which needs to be forced correctly

      • setPositionX

        public void setPositionX(double positionX)
        This sets the positionX of this sprite
        Parameters:
        positionX - represents the x coordinate to be put

      • setPositionY

        public void setPositionY(double positionY)
        This sets the positionY of this sprite
        Parameters:
        positionY - represents the y coordinate to be put

      • setImagePath

        public void setImagePath(java.lang.String path)
        This sets the image path of this sprite
        Parameters:
        path - represents path of image
